intro: Pollalesta vernonioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. It is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
